result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (9th Offense) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (9th Offense) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Randy Leon Heinz was found guilty of OWI (9th Offense), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

supervisions.notes: Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 14CF132, 14TR1524, 14TR1525, &14TR1526. Defendant Randy Leon Heinz in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on the record.  Preliminary hearing addressed, waived by defendant. Court accepts waiver, finds probable cause and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial of said charges.  Information filed. Attorney Szilagyi confirms receipt, waives further reading. Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Count 1.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses outright the PAC citation issued but not yet filed citation number R9098950. Dismisses and reads-in Count 2 & 14TR1524, 14TR1525, & 14TR1526. PSI waived. Court accepts waiver of PSI. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Attorney Szilagyi. No statement by defendant. Statment by court prior to sentencing. Court sentences the defendant to: 96 month Wisconsin State Prison to be served as 42 months Initial Confinement and 54 months Extended Supervision. Credit for 33 days served. CONDITIONS of ES: $3000 fine inclusive of costs, to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. 25 % of earnings to be applied to fine. 36 month DL revocation, 36 Month IID, OWI Assessment. AODA and follow through.   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Court finds defendant not eligible for CIP but eligible for SAP. Appeal Rights Given. Court revokes bond and remands defendant to custody of WSCD.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 12, 2014 at 11:45 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 2:16 PM: Defendant Randy Leon Heinz in court, in custody, with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing in person.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Court entertains waiver of time limits for pre-lim hearing.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of 10 day time limit for pre-lim hearing.  DA will be exchanging discovery and offer in the very near future.   Upon request of Def, counsel request this matter move forward in an expedited manner.  P/S Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2014 at 11:45 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No operation of any motor vehicles whatsoever.

Case called @ 1:15 p.m. Defendant Randy Leon Heinz in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Bryan D. Keberlein.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. ADA Anderson requesting $5000 Cash Bond. Atty Keberlein requesting lower cash bond. Court orders $5000 Cash Bond.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 20, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
